title: Thomas H. Greco Jr.
text:
Thomas Henry Greco Jr. (born October 9, 1936) is a <a href="community%20economics">community economist</a>, who writes and consults on monetary exchange alternatives, including private credit clearing systems, <a href="complementary%20currencies">complementary currencies</a> and <a href="local%20currencies">local currencies</a>.
Education and career.
Greco earned his <a href="bachelor%27s%20degree">bachelor's degree</a> in <a href="chemical%20engineering">chemical engineering</a> from <a href="Villanova%20University">Villanova University</a>, a <a href="Master%20of%20Business%20Administration">Master of Business Administration</a> (MBA) from the <a href="University%20of%20Rochester">University of Rochester</a>, and he pursued a <a href="Doctor%20of%20Philosophy">Doctor of Philosophy</a> (PhD) at <a href="Syracuse%20University">Syracuse University</a>. For fourteen years he taught economics, <a href="finance">finance</a>, <a href="statistics">statistics</a>, <a href="entrepreneurship">entrepreneurship</a>, and <a href="forecasting">forecasting</a> as a tenured faculty member in the college of business at <a href="Rochester%20Institute%20of%20Technology">Rochester Institute of Technology</a>.
In 1979 Thomas Greco became a private consultant and community activist, working with local <a href="Rochester%2C%20New%20York">Rochester, New York</a> peace and justice groups. From 1981 to 1990 he served as <a href="trustee">trustee</a> and then <a href="president%20%28corporate%20title%29">president</a> of the School of Living which promotes "self-governing communities that are democratic, humane, globally conscious and ecologically sound".
A frequent contributor to the <a href="decentralist">decentralist</a> publication "Fourth World Review", Greco organized of the Fourth World Assembly and New Economics Symposium held in San Francisco in 1987. From 1989 to 1991 he co-edited Green Revolution, a journal dedicated to right education, right living and personal responsibility.
After moving to Arizona, Greco assisted in the development of LETSonora (a <a href="Local%20Exchange%20Trading%20System">Local Exchange Trading System</a>) and helped organize Tucson Traders, both now defunct, and in 1991 organized the Community Information Resource Center (CIRC) as a project of NEST, Inc., which promoted transformative approaches to community building.
Greco has authored four books on <a href="monetary%20theory">monetary theory</a> and how practical monetary alternatives can empower communities by generating credit under local control. He has written for a wide range of journals, including the "Internet Journal of Community Research, Alternate, Common Dreams, Transformation, Global Research, Reality Sandwich, <a href="Whole%20Earth%20Review">Whole Earth Review</a>, World Business Academy Perspectives, At Work, Earth Island Journal, the Catholic Worker, The Permaculture Activist, <a href="Yes%21%20%28U.S.%20magazine%29">Yes! Magazine</a>, Green Revolution", and others. Since 2019, he has hosted Beyond Money Podcast.
